head.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Gaza Strip: Protests Over Kidnapped Reporter

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Middle East: Gaza Strip: Protests Over Kidnapped Reporter

abstract.p: Palestinian journalists and others have sit-in outside prime minister's office in Gaza City, to demand increased efforts to find Alan Johnston, BBC correspondent abducted there; Palestinian journalist's union declares three-day news boycott of government and office of Pres Mahmoud Abbas (S)

block.p: More than a hundred Palestinian journalists and others held a sit-in outside the prime minister's office in Gaza City to demand increased efforts to find Alan Johnston, the BBC correspondent abducted there three weeks ago. In the West Bank city of Ramallah, local and international journalists also called on the government to do more. The Palestinian journalists' union declared a three-day news boycott of the government and the office of President Mahmoud Abbas. BBC executives say there has been no information about Mr. Johnston's whereabouts nor any message from his captors saying what they want.

More than a hundred Palestinian journalists and others held a sit-in outside the prime minister's office in Gaza City to demand increased efforts to find Alan Johnston, the BBC correspondent abducted there three weeks ago. In the West Bank city of Ramallah, local and international journalists also called on the government to do more. The Palestinian journalists' union declared a three-day news boycott of the government and the office of President Mahmoud Abbas. BBC executives say there has been no information about Mr. Johnston's whereabouts nor any message from his captors saying what they want.
